item.title: Double yellow lines barely visible, 24th January
item.description:
The double yellow lines at the Overbury St/ London Rd (A40) junction are barely visible. Cars continuously park on this corner, affecting safe access, visibility and blocking the dropped kerb, to the detriment of pedestrians and wheelchair users etc.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 221, London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep, unavoidable, dangerous pot holes, 24th January
item.description:
Pot holes open up here every few months as fixing it with paper mache doesn't seem to hold up. The current ones are particularly deep and dangerous. I buckled my wheel on Thursday. 2nd time in 3 years I've done that there. At night, due to cresting the hill, you don't see them until too late, and they get worse every day so it's hard to avoid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter all the way along a40 Cheltenham direction, 24th January
item.description:
I see there's reports from August 2025, since when it hasn't been dealt with! I did see a litter chap picking up the other side near the layby in the last month which was welcome.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Deep pothole in road, 24th January
item.description:
A deep pothole has appeared in the road. Is particularly bad for cyclists and motorcyclists due to its position in the road. Did have white markings around but have now gone. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.title: Barriers left on grass, 24th January
item.description:
I reported a large pile of mud, rubble and barriers left on the grassy area between Sainsburys Oakley and Redmarley Road to Cheltenham council. It had been there for months. This has been collected now but the pile of barriers has been left behind.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priors Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Approx 1ft by 1ft - Near the end of the T junction, 24th January
item.description:
In the middle of the road. Generally there are cars parked down one side near the T junction so cannot avoid the hole at times. For information there are various pot holes going halfway up the close so these could do with some attention at the same time. Plus right on the T junction itself as a line/long pothole is developing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Sheepscombe Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another patio slab damaged, 24th January
item.description:
Another patio slab damaged and sunken right outside the shop so poses a risk to people - the path is dangerous for people to walk on currently but also is causing us issues pulling in our deliveries as the ground is uneven

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bath Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: As said by fellow user of this road I have lost count over the years that the odd pot hole has been sprayed and poorly filled. Now it has got to the point the road is dangerous and completely unsafe. Huge holes everywhere so uneven it’s basically a fair ground ride going through especially in the dark, if there is one road you want to drive through to knacker your car come to Hayden Lane, this road is not fit for purpose and if you come out and stay a few lines around a whole your just laughable even a child can see how bad It is. South Glos council resurface smaller and less used roads than this so what’s your problem. Close it for a month and repair it properly before someone gets hurt., 24th January
item.description:
All the road from start to finish
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes, 24th January
item.description:
This part of Nine Elms was supposed to be closed and repaired before xmas. It has not happened, The buses for Sir Thomas Riches not helping the situation. The potholes are getting larger and deeper by the day!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
